nodes.bodyText: Why did you remove the test?
Well, it looks like it tests more about Files and Paths, than about our classes, and it is not so easy to rewrite. Will try it tomorrow. Thank you!
Just finished and this Tests removal is reverted. Thank you!
The test hasn't been added back yet.
Returned with refactoring
Why did you remove the test? Would it be possible to rewrite the test without using Power Mockito?

It was testing getter without any logic, I don't think we need to write tests like this in general. But to rewrite this one we need to do some addition code manipulation which will increase risks of regression so I don't think rewriting this test worth it.
It doesn't test just a basic getter within one class. Therefore I wouldn't remove this test.

aren't we removing the use of powermock ? :)
I understand you're doing this because now the powermock dependency is not transitively declared on DMN modules, and also DMN (tests) depends on it?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -267,6 +267,18 @@
       <scope>test</scope>
     </dependency>
 
+    <dependency>

nodes.bodyText: Yes, you are right, DMN modules were transitively dependent on PowerMock and used it, so without this declaration DMN tests will start fail with PowerMock not found.

nodes.bodyText: it can be package protected, so no need for the protected access modifier, this way it results more restrictive (less visible), and we usually have tests on the same package, so the method is already visible for tests.

With package private, test fails with:
[ERROR] testGetAll(org.kie.workbench.common.stunner.project.backend.service.ProjectDiagramServiceControllerTest)  Time elapsed: 0.021 s  <<< ERROR!
org.mockito.exceptions.misusing.InvalidUseOfMatchersException: 

Misplaced argument matcher detected here:

-> at org.kie.workbench.common.stunner.core.backend.service.AbstractVFSDiagramServiceTest.testGetAll(AbstractVFSDiagramServiceTest.java:332)
-> at org.kie.workbench.common.stunner.core.backend.service.AbstractVFSDiagramServiceTest.testGetAll(AbstractVFSDiagramServiceTest.java:332)

You cannot use argument matchers outside of verification or stubbing.
Examples of correct usage of argument matchers:
    when(mock.get(anyInt())).thenReturn(null);
    doThrow(new RuntimeException()).when(mock).someVoidMethod(anyObject());
    verify(mock).someMethod(contains("foo"))

Also, this error might show up because you use argument matchers with methods that cannot be mocked.
Following methods *cannot* be stubbed/verified: final/private/equals()/hashCode().
Mocking methods declared on non-public parent classes is not supported.
oops ok
can be package protected

With package private there is a failing test:
[ERROR] testGetAll(org.kie.workbench.common.stunner.project.backend.service.ProjectDiagramServiceControllerTest)  Time elapsed: 0.025 s  <<< ERROR!

-> at org.kie.workbench.common.stunner.core.backend.service.AbstractVFSDiagramServiceTest.testGetAll(AbstractVFSDiagramServiceTest.java:322)

E.g. thenReturn() may be missing.
Examples of correct stubbing:
    when(mock.isOk()).thenReturn(true);
    when(mock.isOk()).thenThrow(exception);
    doThrow(exception).when(mock).someVoidMethod();
Hints:
 1. missing thenReturn()
 2. you are trying to stub a final method, you naughty developer!
 3: you are stubbing the behaviour of another mock inside before 'thenReturn' instruction if completed

Fixed, thank you!

IMO taking the approach of having an internal "utils" class here makes everythink complex.
I would keep the class as it is, it just provides a few static methods which rely on Errai data binding, so it's clear this class will never work properly on the testing scope.
This way, I would refactor instead the tests that are using this class, as for example you did it on the AbstractVFSDiagramServiceTest class, so by declaring package protected methods which can be mocked, if necessary, to some other result rather than calling the "real" ClientBindingUtils insteance.
WDYT?

The difference between AbstractVFSDiagramService and ClientBindingUtils is ClientBindingUtils is static class without instances, so we can't mock one of it's methods without PowerMock, but AbstractVFSDiagramService isn't a static class and we have instance of it, so we can mock one of it's methods.
But I think we can create DataBinder wrapper which by default will transfer calls to Errai or can be mocked if needed. Will it be better? WDYT?
No need for this if not changing ClientBindingUtils
